entry.title: I miss you , I'm sorry
entry.summary:
Author: Insomia004

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,018Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: Damian always knew that what chained him to this house was Bruce, his father. He was the blood son; he was the rightful heir. He had his father's blood running in his veins; no wonder he felt entitled to everything Bruce-related: his manor, his butler, his children, his love. It was all Damian's—his right. But now everything seemed to be ripped out of his hands, the same way his father's throat was ripped apart. Damian misses his father, but he also misses himself.

entry.title: Operation: Superbat
entry.summary:
Author: cavesongs

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,207Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 194

Summary: A few months after Clark and Lois divorce, a plan is formed to lift Superman's spirits and bring Batman's near two decades of pining to an end. Operation: Superbat begins with the boys stranding their parents in a red sun planet, where they're forced to take a two week vacation—no distractions— and face their feelings for each other once and for all. Everything goes even more wrong when they wake up in cosmic Las Vegas with no memory of the last three days.

entry.title: Every Inch of You
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 32,289Chapters: 22/?Kudos: 250

Summary: "This is a love story." | "This is a detective story"When Clark Kent follows a story into Gotham, he doesn’t expect to find himself face-to-face with the city’s true guardian: a bat with fangs, claws, and a half-feral silhouette in the shadows. Suspicious, circling him like prey, Batman tests every ounce of Clark’s resolve—only for Clark’s clumsy optimism to slip through anyway (“What the hay, are those fangs?”).Between the silk shawls and champagne smiles of Bruce Wayne, Gotham’s Pretty Boy Playboy, and the smudged-eyeliner hunger of the Bat with Fangs, Clark finds himself drawn to both—the golden boy in the sun and the monster in the dark. He doesn’t break Bruce’s walls with force, but with patience, reverence, and devotion.The monster who refuses to hurt the one he loves, and the hero who would even offer his own blood to keep him alive.

entry.title: Clark Kent vs The Batman
entry.summary:
Author: noodlerdoodler

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,993Chapters: 2/5Kudos: 15

Summary: When Clark arrived at the office, running late again, Lois didn’t wait to slide her chair over to his desk. From the sparkle in her eye, he knew something was up. “So, I have an assignment for you, rookie.” Lois said, as a way of greeting. She had already been working at The Daily Planet when Clark was hired, so they had a running joke about her being his superior. Occasionally, it came up in the bedroom. Though, it was more commonly used as a way of teasing him at work, especially when they had been keeping their relationship under wraps. “You know I have to talk to the mayor about the pipe.” Clark responded, already scribbling in the notepad he kept on his desk. “This is a little more exciting than broken pipes.”

entry.title: I swear I'm not a homewrecker
entry.summary:
Author: ChaosQueen1015

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,484Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 57

Summary: “So, have you figured it out by now?” Bruce asked, overestimating the pair’s deductive reasoning skills at the moment.“Figured out that Bruce Wayne is cheating on his husband with Superman who is apparently a homewrecker? OBVIOUSLY!” Hal screeched.“I think I’m gonna be sick,” Barry said dramatically, leaning against the doorway. Bruce and Clark just stared first at them, then at each other silently.“I can’t believe it,” Bruce said, cussing under his breath, “They still haven’t figured out.”“Look, Bruce and I can explain this. I promise you, he’s not a cheater and I am not a homewrecker,” Clark said, trying to give them another chance to figure this out. “There is literally no other explanation for this,” Barry said, staring at the two of them coldly.“There’s a glaring one right under your noses,” Bruce muttered Or Hal Jordan and Barry Allen are convinced Bruce Wayne is cheating on Clark Kent with Superman

Summary: Clark had spent his whole life straddling two worlds, never fully belonging to either. entry.title: Notes and Observations
entry.summary:
Author: mediaraiz

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,933Chapters: 4/13Kudos: 87

Summary: We work. Superman listens when he should, and when he doesn’t, it’s because lives are in the balance. I don’t have to like his methods. I don’t have to like him. But if the League stands, it’s because he chooses to believe in it first. It works. For now.Or: Bruce Wayne’s journals trace thirteen years of rebuilding — through loss and recovery, through family and failure, and through the one constant presence Bruce records but never names for what it is: Clark Kent.

entry.title: A Shadow Of A Ghost
entry.summary:
Author: MysticRose1992

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 33,439Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 1,056

Summary: Danyal Al Ghul was the younger twin brother of Damian Al Ghul, and destined to be his brother’s right hand man, the ghost that whispered the secrets of others in his ear. Danyal was a dangerous foe to have, one that could look at you and know all of your secrets, one that could vanish right in front of you. So, it was both the saddest and the happiest day when Danyal Al Ghul and his guards disappeared, all thought to be dead, when he was ten.Danny Fenton was the quiet weird kid that the strange, eccentric Drs. Maddie and Jack Fenton found and adopted one day. He was deathly silent, and yet with one look from his piercing blue eyes he could silence you. Even with his weird aura around him, he managed to pull two of the only other weird kids into being his best friends. The three of them were inseparable and seemed to have developed their own silent communications.Danny is weirdly smart about certain things and yet seems to be failing his English class. Danny is forced to write an essay that just so happens to win his English class a week-long trip to Gotham. Surely nothing could go wrong with a group of teenagers from Amity Park and the two adults accompanying them in Gotham?
